channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-9194] Break HMaster metrics into multiple contexts
item.description: Some metrics about the HMaster are about RPC call duration and other are about how internal processes are running. We should make the difference clear so that adding more of either kind doesn't confuse the user.
item.summary: Break HMaster metrics into multiple contexts

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
So you should say that these are all from the master. And some of them are already supported. Then most of the rest of them aren't worth the effort to put in.

  • Who is ever going to want to know how long it took to shutdown a master ? (keeping in mind that this isn't stored or sent anywhere before shutdown).
  • There was a lot of cruft that was never used in there: getHServerInfo_avg_time, getProtocolVersion, getProtocolSignature.
  • we don't have row locks anymore. So you don't want to ask for those metrics.

Check out: Hadoop:service=HBase,name=IPC,sub=IPC

for these:


rpc.rpc.NumOpenConnections

rpc.rpc.ReceivedBytes

rpc.rpc.RpcProcessingTimeAvgTime

rpc.rpc.RpcProcessingTimeNumOps

rpc.rpc.RpcQueueTimeAvgTime

rpc.rpc.RpcQueueTimeNumOps

and these:


rpc.rpc.rpcAuthenticationFailures

rpc.rpc.rpcAuthenticationSuccesses

rpc.rpc.rpcAuthorizationFailures

rpc.rpc.RpcAuthorizationSuccesses

There are already metrics on compaction in the region server.

So overall I disagree with 90%+ of your list. Adding metrics for AssignmentManager and Balancer, create table, disable, and drop sure.

First 9 metrics in original list are actually present, removed.

Batch of 4 metrics w.r.t. authentication are found too.
What is the list now? I can't read this jira the way it is edited.

The list is in description of the JIRA.

I got the original list from another team. I am in the process of finalizing the list with them.

Will start adding AssignmentManager related metrics.

The list is full of rubbish metrics.

I suggest we close this issue since it is obviously filed w/o thought, w/o edit.

This has a 95 equivalent:


rpc.rpc.callQueueLen

These are from the region server and they all have a 95 equivalent:


rpc.rpc.checkAndDelete_avg_time

rpc.rpc.checkAndDelete_num_ops

rpc.rpc.checkAndPut_avg_time

rpc.rpc.checkAndPut_num_ops

rpc.rpc.get_avg_time

rpc.rpc.get_num_ops

rpc.rpc.incrementColumnValue_avg_time

rpc.rpc.incrementColumnValue_num_ops

rpc.rpc.increment_avg_time

rpc.rpc.increment_num_ops

rpc.rpc.multi_avg_time

rpc.rpc.multi_num_ops

rpc.rpc.next_avg_time

rpc.rpc.put_avg_time

rpc.rpc.put_num_ops

rpc.rpc.delete_avg_time

rpc.rpc.delete_num_ops

If you go to /metrics on the web ui (rs or master) you'll get a nice json will all of the metrics that are currently being emitted. That can help you look at what's there for yourself.

I did some search under hbase-hadoop2-compat
I found callQueueLenGauge in MetricsThriftServerSourceImpl.java only.

For checkAndDelete_XX, I found checkMutateFailedCount and checkMutatePassedCount in MetricsRegionServerSourceImpl but not the average time or number of ops.
queueSize
numOps = Passed + Failed.
Patch v1 adds time for balancer run as histogram.
The attached patch doesn't time a significant number of ways that the balancer is run. There needs to be an rpc context and a master context.

a significant number of ways that the balancer is run

Are you referring to calls to assignmentManager.balance() ?

Are you expecting this metric to be added in MetricsHBaseServerSourceImpl ?

Thanks

w.r.t. rpc context, if we call MetricsHBaseServer methods in RpcServer#call(), we need to parse the method name along with matching BlockingService.
Considering the number of metrics would increase, the above doesn't seem scalable.

Accumulating metrics on Master side, there would be no such parsing.

Please comment.

That's correct. Take a look at how HRegion/HRegionServer expose calls from outside vs internals. Exposing things from the HMaster vs things happening in the balancer is totally do-able that just needs to be made manifest in the naming and contexts description.

In HRegionServer, MetricsRegionServer is used to update metrics.


      metricsRegionServer.updateGet(EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTimeMillis() - before);

Patch v1 follows the same approach by using MetricsMaster.

Please comment on what needs to be done based on patch v1.
that just needs to be made manifest in the naming and contexts description.

I looked at the metaHlogSplitTime metric that was added for HBASE-7006.
Patch v1 modified the same set of files for adding the new metric.

I asked Jeffrey to read the above comment but he didn't seem to tell me more.

Can you elaborate a bit more ?

Something like having an assignment manager context that times the time for each of the blancer methods and all the other am related things. Then it's obvious that there's a time for the blancer and that there are rpc calls into master.
I'll just take this.

This is what I was thinking. This patch splits out all of the internal metrics into different contexts so they have descriptions.

Now adding metrics into the Server context should be easy and the resulting metrics names won't confuse the user.
rebased on trunk
Nice refactoring.
